intro: Cheiranthus pallidus, commonly known as the pale wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustards. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its flowers are small, yellowish-white, and often appear in clusters, blooming from spring to early summer. The leaves are linear to lance-shaped, and the plant is often found in coastal or alpine regions.
